author.bio:
I'm cqtz- on reddit and cqtz on SaidIt. https://youtube.com/watch?v=o_LskiXQ73c

You can still see my posts on archive.org. And check out +uslashremoved!
author.bio_html:
I'm cqtz- on reddit and cqtz on SaidIt. https://youtube.com/watch?v=o_LskiXQ73c

You can still see my posts on archive.org. And check out +uslashremoved!

body:
Edit: I forgot to mention that since the Home listing is the same as the Trending listing, they don't show up there either.

In other words, the "hide politics" filter, which filters posts based on this [keyword list](https://ruqqus.com/politics.txt), is turned on for logged out users.

This was not mentioned in +changelog. I don't know if it was intended or not.

**Edit 2: This was unintended. See @captainmeta4's comment.**
body_html:
Edit: I forgot to mention that since the Home listing is the same as the Trending listing, they don't show up there either.

In other words, the "hide politics" filter, which filters posts based on this keyword list, is turned on for logged out users.

This was not mentioned in +changelog. I don't know if it was intended or not.

Edit 2: This was unintended. See @captainmeta4's comment.

guild.description:
Changes that aren't announced in +changelog or +ruqqus

Post whatever you notice (it doesn't have to be an important change, even changes in punctuation/spelling are ok)

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus

Update on 2021-01-29:

If you want to be the GM of this guild, make a post here.

author.bio:
I'm cqtz- on reddit and cqtz on SaidIt. https://youtube.com/watch?v=o_LskiXQ73c

author.bio_html:
I'm cqtz- on reddit and cqtz on SaidIt. https://youtube.com/watch?v=o_LskiXQ73c

You can still see my posts on archive.org. And check out +uslashremoved!

body:
I should probably ask the admins about this. I think that in the past, they've had an issue where the [slur filter was turned on for logged out users](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/13az/ruqqus-is-now-quarantining-guilds-certain), and I think it was unintended.

@captainmeta4, it seems that the "hide politics" filter is turned on for logged out users. Is this intended? If it is, can you make it only apply to the "Home" page or have an off switch somewhere, and can you explicitly write on the page that the filter is on?
body_html:
I should probably ask the admins about this. I think that in the past, they've had an issue where the slur filter was turned on for logged out users, and I think it was unintended.

@captainmeta4, it seems that the "hide politics" filter is turned on for logged out users. Is this intended? If it is, can you make it only apply to the "Home" page or have an off switch somewhere, and can you explicitly write on the page that the filter is on?

author.bio:
Ruqqus cofounder and lead backend developer.

https://github.com/captainmeta4
author.bio_html:
Ruqqus cofounder and lead backend developer.

https://github.com/captainmeta4

body_html:
Yep, I dun gone and fucked up the logic. That will be fixed in next patch. Thanks for bringing it to my attention.

@FellowRuqquser

edit: take a look on https://dev.ruqqus.com and see if it looks the way you expect.
